feature.name: Daily Wage Calculator
feature.description: The Daily Wage Calculator is a payroll system feature designed to precisely calculate salary deductions for employees taking unpaid leave. It provides an automated mechanism to determine accurate pay reductions by dividing an employee's total salary (basic + allowances) by the number of actual working days in a month. The system intelligently handles different leave policies, accommodating both calendar day and working day calculations, and automatically accounts for public holidays that may impact the total working days. This feature ensures fair and transparent salary adjustments by systematically subtracting unpaid leave days from an employee's monthly compensation. By integrating with payroll and leave management systems, it streamlines the complex process of managing salary deductions, reduces manual calculation errors, and provides HR personnel with a reliable tool for handling unpaid leave scenarios. The calculator supports flexible leave policies and automatically generates precise payroll deductions, enhancing administrative efficiency and financial accuracy. The Daily Wage Calculator is an advanced payroll tool designed to provide organizations with flexible and precise methods for calculating employee compensation. It addresses previous limitations in wage calculation by offering multiple calculation bases including calendar days, working days, and custom days. The solution enables payroll managers to customize wage calculations by selecting specific salary components such as basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only. This tool specifically supports critical payroll processes like salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions. By accommodating different regional labor law requirements, such as the 30-day month standard in UAE and KSA, the calculator provides granular control over wage computations. The flexibility allows companies to align their payroll calculations with specific organizational policies and legal frameworks. Organizations can now handle complex wage calculations with greater accuracy and transparency, reducing manual computation errors and standardizing compensation processes. The Daily Wage Calculator is a payroll management tool designed to help organizations proportionally calculate employee salaries based on actual days worked. It provides super administrators with flexible options to prorate salaries using different calculation bases such as custom days, calendar days, or working days. The feature enables precise salary adjustments for an employee's first salary and end-of-service settlements, ensuring accurate compensation tracking. By allowing granular control over salary calculations, organizations can adapt their payroll processes to various employment scenarios and work arrangements. The tool integrates directly with the payroll system, automatically applying selected proration methods to active payroll transactions. This functionality helps maintain payroll accuracy, supports fair compensation practices, and provides administrative flexibility in managing employee earnings.

procedures.when_to_use: For prorating salaries, calculating leave encashment, and determining unpaid leave deductions

steps: Go to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation
Select calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days)
If payroll month is open, reject existing prorated salary transactions

rules_limitations_constraints.rule: Daily pay calculated by dividing total salary by number of actual working days
Can use either calendar days (30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days)
Public holidays must be subtracted from working days
Calculation can be based on calendar days, working days, or custom days
Can exclude weekends and public holidays
Most UAE and KSA companies use 30 custom days to align with labor law
Changes will affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table
When payroll month is open, super admin must reject existing prorated salary transactions before saving new proration settings

edge_cases_warnings.edge_case_or_warning: Public holidays must be considered and subtracted from working days when calculating daily pay
Calculation varies depending on month length (e.g., 31 days in January, 28 days in February)
When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist, super admin must manually reject and resave transactions

Interacts with Payroll settings, public holiday calendar, and leave management systems
Interacts with Payroll system and affects active payroll table transactions

markdown_report:
# Zendesk Documentation – Daily Wage Calculator

Generated on: 2025-12-22

## Feature Overview (From Zendesk articles)
The Daily Wage Calculator is a payroll system feature designed to precisely calculate salary deductions for employees taking unpaid leave. It provides an automated mechanism to determine accurate pay reductions by dividing an employee's total salary (basic + allowances) by the number of actual working days in a month. The system intelligently handles different leave policies, accommodating both calendar day and working day calculations, and automatically accounts for public holidays that may impact the total working days. This feature ensures fair and transparent salary adjustments by systematically subtracting unpaid leave days from an employee's monthly compensation. By integrating with payroll and leave management systems, it streamlines the complex process of managing salary deductions, reduces manual calculation errors, and provides HR personnel with a reliable tool for handling unpaid leave scenarios. The calculator supports flexible leave policies and automatically generates precise payroll deductions, enhancing administrative efficiency and financial accuracy. The Daily Wage Calculator is an advanced payroll tool designed to provide organizations with flexible and precise methods for calculating employee compensation. It addresses previous limitations in wage calculation by offering multiple calculation bases including calendar days, working days, and custom days. The solution enables payroll managers to customize wage calculations by selecting specific salary components such as basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only. This tool specifically supports critical payroll processes like salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions. By accommodating different regional labor law requirements, such as the 30-day month standard in UAE and KSA, the calculator provides granular control over wage computations. The flexibility allows companies to align their payroll calculations with specific organizational policies and legal frameworks. Organizations can now handle complex wage calculations with greater accuracy and transparency, reducing manual computation errors and standardizing compensation processes. The Daily Wage Calculator is a payroll management tool designed to help organizations proportionally calculate employee salaries based on actual days worked. It provides super administrators with flexible options to prorate salaries using different calculation bases such as custom days, calendar days, or working days. The feature enables precise salary adjustments for an employee's first salary and end-of-service settlements, ensuring accurate compensation tracking. By allowing granular control over salary calculations, organizations can adapt their payroll processes to various employment scenarios and work arrangements. The tool integrates directly with the payroll system, automatically applying selected proration methods to active payroll transactions. This functionality helps maintain payroll accuracy, supports fair compensation practices, and provides administrative flexibility in managing employee earnings.

## Observed Jobs To Be Done
- Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages, including salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Primary Personas
- HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Superadmin [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Payroll table managers [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Transaction processors [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Super admin [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Navigation Paths
- Unpaid Leave Request → Approval → Pay Deduction Calculation | context: Process for handling unpaid leave salary adjustments | [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation | context: Accessing the Daily Wage Calculator | [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation | context: Accessing salary proration configuration | [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Prerequisites
- Approved unpaid leave request [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Access to payroll settings [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Company's public holiday calendar configured [Articles: 14243704039185]
- User must have super admin permissions [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Required Inputs
- Employee's total salary (basic + allowance) | details: Full monthly salary used for daily rate calculation | [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Number of working days in the month | details: Can be calendar days (30) or working days (22), excluding public holidays | [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Calculation base | details: Options include calendar days, working days, or custom days | [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Salary components | details: Basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only | [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Calculation basis | details: Options include custom days, calendar days, or working days | [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Expected Outputs
- Automatic pay deduction | details: Reflected on the payroll table, calculated daily pay rate for unpaid leave | [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Daily wage rates | details: Calculated for salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction | [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Updated salary calculations | details: Proportionally adjusted employee compensation based on selected calculation method | [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Procedures
- **Daily Pay Calculation** | when_to_use: For processing unpaid leave salary deductions | steps: Receive and approve unpaid leave request → Determine leave policy (calendar or working days) → Calculate total working days → Subtract public holidays from working days → Calculate daily pay rate: Salary / Working Days → Generate payroll deduction | [Articles: 14154746403601]
- **Daily Wage Calculation** | when_to_use: For prorating salaries, calculating leave encashment, and determining unpaid leave deductions | steps: Navigate to Settings → Select Payroll → Choose Daily Wage Calculation → Select calculation base → Choose salary components → Apply calculation | [Articles: 14243704039185]
- **Update Salary Proration** | when_to_use: When adjusting salary calculation methods | steps: Go to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation → Select calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days) → Save changes → If payroll month is open, reject existing prorated salary transactions → Confirm new proration settings | [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Rules / Limitations / Constraints
- Daily pay calculated by dividing total salary by number of actual working days [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Can use either calendar days (30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days) [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Public holidays must be subtracted from working days [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Calculation can be based on calendar days, working days, or custom days [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Can exclude weekends and public holidays [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Most UAE and KSA companies use 30 custom days to align with labor law [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Changes will affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table [Articles: 14243760419089]
- When payroll month is open, super admin must reject existing prorated salary transactions before saving new proration settings [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Edge Cases & Warnings
- Public holidays must be considered and subtracted from working days when calculating daily pay [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Calculation varies depending on month length (e.g., 31 days in January, 28 days in February) [Articles: 14243704039185]
- When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist, super admin must manually reject and resave transactions [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Feature Interactions / Dependencies
- Interacts with payroll system to create and reflect pay deductions [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Interacts with Payroll settings, public holiday calendar, and leave management systems [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Interacts with Payroll system and affects active payroll table transactions [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Glossary Terms
- Daily Pay: Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) divided by the number of actual working days in the month [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Salary proration: Calculating partial salary based on days worked [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Leave encashment: Monetary compensation for unused leave days [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Proration: Proportional adjustment of salary based on actual days worked [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Claims To Validate
- (calculation_rule) | Daily pay is calculated by dividing total monthly salary by the number of actual working days | hint: Verify calculation matches: Total Salary / Working Days | risk: low | [Articles: 14154746403601]
- (system_behavior) | Public holidays are automatically subtracted from total working days | hint: Check that holiday days reduce the working day count | risk: low | [Articles: 14154746403601]
- (navigation) | User can access Daily Wage Calculator via Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation | hint: Verify navigation path exists | risk: low | [Articles: 14243704039185]
- (system_behavior) | Calculator supports three calculation bases: calendar days, working days, and custom days | hint: Verify all three calculation base options are available | risk: low | [Articles: 14243704039185]
- (calculation_rule) | Users can select salary components: basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only | hint: Confirm these three salary component options exist | risk: low | [Articles: 14243704039185]
- (navigation) | Super admin can navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation | hint: Verify UI path exists and is accessible | risk: low | [Articles: 14243760419089]
- (ui_step) | User can select from custom days, calendar days, or working days calculation basis | hint: Verify all three options are available and selectable | risk: low | [Articles: 14243760419089]
- (system_behavior) | Saving proration changes affects all active (unpaid) amounts in payroll table | hint: Confirm changes propagate to unpaid payroll transactions | risk: medium | [Articles: 14243760419089]
